attributes.action: Improve the morale of NHS working staff by reducing the disparity in wages
attributes.background: The morale of the working staff in the NHS is at an all time low ebb. So it's no surprise that they take little pleasure in going to work, and that enthusiasm is lacking. A committee is needed to balance the difference in wages and working conditions between the different tiers of the hierarchy.
attributes.additional_details: I have had firsthand experience in this matter, visiting hospitals once a month for the last 10 years for treatment. After speaking to numerous members of the nursing staff, it became apparent that a large majority were unhappy with the working conditions and the difference in pay between themselves and more senior doctors in the NHS. I wish for this matter to be discussed, and for the balancing of wages to be considered by a committee.

attributes.action: An NHS research investment donation app for mobile phones and computers.
attributes.background: Well I have ulcerative colitis and every time I go to hospital I notice there are a lot of people who would like to be able to do more and feel as if they can do nothing at least with a app people can send money to invest in research in areas where they would like to see improvements in research.
attributes.additional_details: I don't feel evidence is something needed in this case. Good people invest in good things and this is one of them.

attributes.action: Address the rise in incidences of dangerous driving on UK roads.
attributes.background: There is a lack of deterrent for dangerous drivers on UK roads. Speeding, illegal manoeuvring and blatant disregard for the Highway Code seem to have become common-place. The UK needs to rethink it's reliance on speed cameras, speed humps, etc. and begin enforcing speed and dangerous driving laws.

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: A government review into the feasibility of driverless trains within the UK
attributes.background: We request a government led industry review, working with all train operators/ management and unions into the feasibility of driverless trains in the UK. The current approach where millions of the population are constrained by the availability of train drivers (sickness or strike) is not acceptable
attributes.additional_details:
Driverless technology is being adopted across the car industry (e.g. Google, Nissan and Tesla). This technology on complex, multi vehicle transport routes. 
https://www.cbinsights.com/blog/autonomous-driverless-vehicles-corporations-list/

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Restrict the speed of cyclists on mixed pedestrian/cyclist paths to 4 mph.
attributes.background: It is becoming very common for local authorities to improve provision for cyclists, at the expense of pedestrians, by making footpaths multi use. By the simple expedient of painting a bicycle on the footpath pedestrians lose the exclusive use of the footpath.
attributes.additional_details:
The figures for death and serious injury to pedestrians involved in accidents with cyclists is very low. But there is a perception of danger especially from inconsiderate riders.
If cyclists were restricted, to 4 mph as are class 2 mobility scooters, this would reduce the perceived threat from cyclists. This would create a compromise in mixing pedestrians with cyclists. This accepts the inevitable use by cyclists of the footpath and protects pedestrians as vulnerable road users.

attributes.action: Ensure restaurant/food seller menus list any present allergens in their food
attributes.background: In many restaurants it is difficult to know if an allergen is present in the food being served. Allergy sufferers should be able to see what is going into their food, as they can on supermarket packaging. A menu with a full list of ingredients should therefore be available if required.

attributes.action: Cap private rents at Local Housing Allowance (LHA) levels in England
attributes.background: LHAs are not typical of private rents. Those claiming Housing Benefit still have to top up their total rent from other benefits - often an impossible task, leading to rent arrears and crippling poverty. LHAs must be brought into line with actual private rents, or rents capped at the level of LHA.

attributes.action: Government to fund a program to help local councils to house the homeless.
attributes.background: When you walk through any city, today you will see numerous homeless people, many of us have probably looked down at them as wasters but if you stop, sit and talk to them you will realise that misguided. The time for action is now, Government needs to give the councils the money to help the homeless
attributes.additional_details: They are from all walks of life but have one thing in common down on luck. I have started siting down and talking to some who I see reguarly over the last year or so. From the ex-soldier with no where to go, to the college student who had quit her course when she became homeless. All tell the same story, living on sofas, looking for a job, 1 night on the street turns into 2 which before long is 367.

attributes.action: Prevent motorway central reservation grass cutting
attributes.background: The cost in time and lost commerce is immense and so un-necessary, it's naturally sown wild grasses and flowers (and helps prevent glare at night from headlamps on the opposite carriageway). Three times this week I have been delayed by these works totalling 3 hours in delays.

attributes.action: Ban political nominations for the Queens honours list
attributes.background: The curry system has been brought into disrepute by David Cameron.

attributes.action: Make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.background: Im a food lover and blogger and I want to make a change. I have loved food ever since I watched a Jamie Oliver christmas special back in 2006. My love for food and specifically helping younger people have grown over the years and now I want to kick up a fuss and make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.additional_details: The number of children taking Food Technology at GCSE is dropping. Too many kids nowadays are growing up not knowing how about food, with around 2 million children growing up with just one parent-it is questionable that mums and dads just don't have the time to teach their children how to cook/bake. The Department of Education quite clearly is TOO focused on wanting the children of the future to grow up to become more academic.

attributes.action: Make changes to the Dartford crossing procedure.
attributes.background: When using the Dartford river crossing there are signs telling drivers when and how to pay but these are easily missed. I propose that they either bring back the tolls or send a letter to drivers telling them when and how to pay.

attributes.action: Make GPs stop giving out prescriptions for over the counter painkillers
attributes.background: In 2015 the NHS spent 87 million pound on prescriptions for paracetemol alone aswell as 27 million on ibruprofen. These are medication that can be purchased for 20p in any shop imagine the money the NHS could save and how many urgent operations could be made with the money that will be saved.

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for those involved in the puppy farm trade.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is one of the largest contributors of animal cruelty within Britain. No animal should have to go through the distress and abusive conditions that happen within this barbaric industry. Those who take part in this trade should suffer a heavy penalty for this act of cruelty.

attributes.action: Call for a Ban on the Industrial Manufacture of Honey in the UK
attributes.background:
Current methods cause massive unnecessary slaughter of Bees. Bees are vital to our survival and to maintaining our delicate eco systems
Unnatural methods used by industrial beekeepers, such as A.I, antibiotics, clipping a Queen Bee's wings are wholly unacceptable
All to satisfy corporate greed
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/GreenWorldTVUK/videos/1623198151304386/?__mref=message

attributes.action: Force bars, restaurants and nightclubs to sell more varieties of diet drinks
attributes.background: Despite an apparent obesity crisis in the UK and more people being diagnosed with diabetes, drinking establishments don't sell enough diet drinks. These venues should be forced to sell the diet variety of any soft drink they sell, to improve peoples health and wellbeing.

attributes.action: Abolish the Early Years Teacher Status
attributes.background: The Early Years Teacher Status was introduced in an attempt to provide children in the Early Years with specialist practitioners. These specialists would be responsible for providing high-quality early education, something many lower qualified practitioners already do on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst the EYTS qualifies a practitioner as an Early Years teacher, it does not align itself to QTS and the pay of a teacher with QTS. Therefore, many holders of EYTS are paid substianirslly less than teachers and their are very limited opportunities. Many schools will opt for a holder of QTS than EYTS. In addition, due to, a lack of clarity many nurseries are unsure of the role, the qualification and the rate of pay meaning some Early Years Teschers are paid minimum wage.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all school children to learn sign language.
attributes.background: Personally, I feel like sign language should be something everyone should know. Im not deaf nor do I know anyone who is but I can easily empathise with the deaf community and can understand that a world where most people are unable to communicate with you must be rather terrifying.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.actiononhearingloss.org.uk/your-hearing/ways-of-communicating/british-sign-language-bsl.aspx

attributes.action: Stop self employed people paying tax in advance as paye do not pay in advance
attributes.background: As self employed individual I pay tax in advance and really struggle to do so .I am a self employed electrician ,I have good years and bad years so when the HMRC asked for money in advance , I really struggle to pay it ,this is unfair as when I was a paye they never asked for 6 month tax ahead
attributes.additional_details:
If I should fall short of money ,example people paying me late . Then I have to pay interest on tax money I should be paying in advance to the HMRC. 
I believe this system makes many small individuals and small company's go out of business. 
Let's to be fair to all who work paye and self employed people

attributes.action: Bypass BREXIT but work for EU reform to allow UK border immigration control
attributes.background: Parliament is a representative democracy but should urgently respond to the disquiet over immigration expressed in the referendum. The implications of BREXIT are potentially horrendous for both the UK and EU and it is critical not to terminate, but to reformulate our membership.
attributes.additional_details: The  Referendum, widely recognized to have flawed origins and severely compromised by misinformation, should be considered accordingly. There are now new opportunities first to renegotiate our relationship with the EU regarding border control, and then work to improve structures with democratic processes, openness and transparency at its heart.

attributes.action: send an allied task force to eliminate ISIS
attributes.background: ISIS must be destroyed before they can kill more innocent civilians.

attributes.action: Stop media from publicising the nationality of criminals to prevent prejudice
attributes.background: If a nationality is associated with a horrible act of violence in the media, it is easy for readers to then associate people of that nationality with acts of terror and violence. This can make innocent people of that nationality very prone to racism and prejudice.

attributes.action: Make all fuel stations / garage forecourts give free air and water.
attributes.background: It is a legal requirement to keep tyres inflated at the correct pressure and to have a clear visible view of the road. Stop making  people have to pay to keep there car legal on the road! Some garages already give free air and water. It's just more revenue for the fuel companies.

attributes.action: Let motorcycle riders over 25, drive cars up to 1.0 without L plates and test
attributes.background: I can drive safely and confidently, and so can all other motorcyclists that are old enough to do this maturely. Ie over 25 year olds. In a low powered car it is going to be far safer in poor weather, rain. Wind,  winter conditions etc than on a motorcycle without the hassle and cost of another test

attributes.action: Make  verbal abuse of teachers by students and parents an offense like the NHS
attributes.background: Teachers need respect given to them to ensure that they can perform well in the classroom. Often behaviour policies in schools are so varied that students, parents and carers in some cases seem to get away without any consequences to verbal abuse of the teacher.
attributes.additional_details: This is a stop verbal abuse of teachers campaign.

attributes.action: Change School Holiday Rules
attributes.background:
I have 2 children and have worked in a school for 6 years.
Booking a holiday in the school break can be double the amount than in term time,as the travel firms give school holiday weeks high season rates, making it impossible for lots of families to go away on holiday.
Lets change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The 6 week holiday is to long for many reasons.
I suggest taking 2 weeks off the 6 week break.Let children have these 2 weeks a year in term time,this way there will be no set period each year for holiday companies to include them in high season rates, as there would be if added to half term breaks.The teachers could take their 2 weeks the last week of the Summer and Autumn terms, as these are wind down weeks and not much work takes place,it could easily be covered by TA's or relief teachers.

attributes.action: Stop UK Airports and Private companies making money from Airport forecourts.
attributes.background:
Airports in the UK have gradually introduced charging for dropping off and in some cases are using private companies and the Police to enforce only picking people up from inside the terminals rather than on the forecourts.
I feel this is not a security issue but rather a money making exercise!
attributes.additional_details:
Heathrow - Dropoff only free and Police (HAL Bylaws) enforcement for pickup in terminal.
London City - Dropoff free and new enforcement of Pickup in Shortstay £5.50!
Stansted - Forecourt dropoff or pickup now £3.00 for 10 mins!
Luton Airport - Dropoff area £2.50 for 10 minutes and Expensive Shortstay for pickups.

People in the Hackney Carriage, Taxi & Private Hire industry especially are having a hard enough time making a living at present without these indiscriminate rules.

attributes.action: Release official files relating to past business dealings of Sir Mark Thatcher
attributes.background:
Downing Street files relating to past business dealings of Sir Mark Thatcher are being kept secret despite rules stating official documents should be published after 20 years. 
There is no legitimate reason to keep them out the public domain and they should be released immediately.

attributes.action: Make the smoking of tobacco in a household with children under 18 an offense.
attributes.background: In England there is already a ban on smoking in a car with children under 18, however smoke can linger within rooms of a home for long periods of time, this and smoke residue that falls on food and surfaces can put children the most at risk of health problems as their lungs are not fully developed.
attributes.additional_details:
"It’s estimated that, every year, second-hand smoke kills over 12,000 people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and the lung disease Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)."
- Cancer Research UK

http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking#qUzJibFS5IwmCGXk.99

attributes.action: Stop the minting of Copper Coins
attributes.background: There is very little that can be purchsed for 1p or 2p now, so it is pointless having these coins. It is also a waste of money minting them. If the lowest denomination of coin minted was 5p then everything could be priced at £x.95 instead of £x.99
attributes.additional_details:
New Zealand's smallest coin is the 10c which is approximately equivalent to 5p (GBP)
Australia has scrapped its 1c & 2c and its 5c coin is approximately equivalent to 3p (GBP)
In the USA it has long been known that minting the 1c coin actually costs more than 1c per coin.
Many people in the UK often throw away 1p & 2p coins as they are practically worthless.

attributes.action: Total referendum votes per geographic area should not be made public.
attributes.background: An individuals vote in the UK is private and is only public if they choose it to be so. This should also apply too the votes of geographic areas and age groups. So this same consideration for privacy of individuals should apply also to geographic areas and age groups.
attributes.additional_details: There is no reason for this information to be made public or even recorded, except for the media to create drama and a division within the country. When a democracy makes a decision, the result should be the nations result and not multiple results specific to areas of the country, or a age group. Focusing what percentage voted what and where, serves no benefit to the nation, and only divides it. So no longer provide the public with a group to attack, when a vote does not go ones way.

attributes.action: We demand Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty be invoked within three months hereof.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, we, the people of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland delivered a mandate, pursuant to the EU Referendum Act 2015, that we exit the EU. We hereby demand that effect be given to said mandate by way of invoking Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty within 3 months.
attributes.additional_details:
"I do declare that no foreign prince, person, prelate, state or potentate hath or ought to have jurisdiction, power, superiority, pre-eminence or authority within this Realm." - Bill of Rights, 1689

These words serve to enshrine British sovereignty in its Constitution which remains violated for as long as the UK is a member of the EU. Notwithstanding a mandate to remedy the position by exiting the EU,  PM Ms. May suggests exit will be delayed or worse, not happen at all. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Stop the banks from creating money from commecial debt, ending boom and bust.
attributes.background: The creation of commecial money from the inflationary act of creating money from debt is responsible for the boom and bust cycles. We need to end the fractional reserve banking where banks are allowed to lend money that they do not have, gaining purchasing power and interest from money they created.
attributes.additional_details:
http://positivemoney.org/videos/97-owned-monetary-reform-documentary/

http://www.investopedia.com/terms/f/fractionalreservebanking.asp

http://positivemoney.org/2011/09/fractional-reserve-banking-leads-booms-busts/

attributes.action: Allow encrypted information to be accessed by security services and government
attributes.background: Terrorists and criminals frequently use the Internet and social media to encourage acts of terrorism and criminal activity. If there is a cause for concern, the government and security services should be allowed access to prevent attacks and protect citizens.

attributes.action: Review the way the Department of Work and Pensions treats mentally ill claimants
attributes.background: I am doing this on behalf of a friend who has suffered with long term depression and has been treated appallingly by the DWP. I am concerned that this is not a one-off case and that there are a lot of vulnerable people who are being treated in such an irresponsible and dangerous manner.

attributes.action: Increase the UK's military response against ISIS
attributes.background: The UK has been a part of a US-led coalition against ISIS for nearly two years. In that time period terrorist attacks around the world and against our allies have increased dramatically. We must increase our military efforts to ensure our safety and the safety of our allies by destroying ISIS.
attributes.additional_details: The death toll from ISIS terrorist attacks was 9 in 2013, increased to 1,020 in 2015 and is currently at 840 in 2016 after the horrific attack in Nice. The numbers of attacks continue to increase and ISIS continue to target some of our greatest allies such as Belgium, France and the United States. We must increase our efforts against ISIS to ensure that we are safe from terrorist attacks and to ensure the freedoms we hold so dear are protected.

attributes.action: Maintain Freedom of Movement within EU countries that currently have the Euro.
attributes.background: As most countries with the Euro have economies similar to our own I feel this would help reduce low-skilled immigration while maintaining freedoms for those UK citizens who wish to live and work in Europe. I believe this would represent both sides of the recent referendum vote.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.migrationwatchuk.org/statistics-net-migration-statistics

As you will see from the link more people entered the UK from Non-EU countries 277,000 than EU countries 270,000. If you select the EU8 and EU2 options you see that the countries without the Euro make up 160,000 of the total amount of EU immigration. Therefore negotiating a situation that maintains Free Movement of Workers with countries that have the Euro will still allow a more than 50% reduction of uncontrolled EU immigration and yet maintain opportunities in the majority of Europe for UK citizens.

attributes.action: Amend Fixed-Term Parliaments Act to require a General Election if the PM resigns
attributes.background: When voting during a General Election, it is likely voters base their decision not only on who they want to represent them locally, but also who they would like to represent the country on the global stage. If the PM resigns, the public should get to vote again based on the new leadership.
attributes.additional_details:
Why the resignation comes about is irrelevant - this is NOT to do with the current Brexit issue.

This is NOT a request for a GE based purely on the outcome of the referendum (and so is vastly different to petition 133548), but for a change in the law to cover scenarios whereby the PM chooses to resign during a fixed term parliament. 

The public should get to choose the new Prime Minister, knowing who it is that's going to lead the country for the next 5 years, not just the members of a party.

attributes.action: Prime Minister suspend 3rd Heathrow runway until Brexit negotiations complete
attributes.background:
Economic case for 3rd runway Heathrow can't be justified until all Brexit negotiations complete & or 2nd referendum.
Under Brexit if carried out, London may no longer retain hub status. If Scotland negotiates to remain in EU, strong economic case Edinburgh & Glasgow become future gateways to Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Assumptions of Heathrow expansion economic projections are based on London being at focal point of connection between UK & other European countries. Logic may now not hold true.
Until full scale of Brexit negotiations are known economic case for 3rd Heathrow runway is tenuous.
If after Brexit negotiations on UK leaving EU, Scotland negotiates to remain part of EU, perfectly conceivable Edinburgh & Glasgow could become significant economic hubs in their own right. Less need for Heathrow expansion

attributes.action: RSPCA vehicles to have some type of emergency lighting
attributes.background: RSPCA vehicles need to have some type of emergency lighting because pets mean the world to someone like everyone else, and animals need help quickly too and they can't get to places during rush hour traffic so its life or death for an animal

attributes.action: Introduce better benefits for stay at home parents.
attributes.background: Child care is very expensive which means some parents decided to live off one wage and have a stay at home Mum or Dad for their child. I feel that there is not enough financial help from the government for stay at home parents.Sometimes the wage of one isn't enough.

attributes.action: Change the driving license rules for up to 7.5 tonne vehicles.
attributes.background: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations 1996 needs to be adapted to include C1 and C1E category after provisional on a background check-points basis so that all the people who were born from 1979 onwards get the same driving possibilities as those who passed their driving test before 1996.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands today, anyone who has passed their driving test prior to 1996 can drive any vehicle up to 7.5 tonnes. In 1998 this meant that a few thousand 18 and 19 year-olds were left out of the equation but by 2016, not only everybody from 18 to 37 (roughly 16.8 million people) can't drive a large van or small lorry but your 75 year-old granny can. This leaves many responsible grown-ups finding it very difficult when needing to drive, hire or purchase any vehicle between 3.5 and 7.5 tonnes.

attributes.action: Final Leader elections in Government or Opposition should be by national vote.
attributes.background: Parlimentary leadership elections are decided by a small fraction of the electorate. This could see a vastly different Prime Minister or leader of the Opposition than the electorate intended to put in power and could in instances give rise to instability at a time when greater stability is required.

attributes.action: Sue the EU via the ECJ for the monies the UK should of had under our old rebate
attributes.background: In 2005, Blair gave up 40% of the UK rebate in return for future reforms of the EU. Since those reforms were never made - we should be refunded the money. Full transcripts of those meetings should be made public to ensure the EU did not persuade blair by offering him help with an EU presidency bid
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/6516753/Tony-Blairs-decision-to-cut-the-EU-rebate-cost-9.3billion-report-shows.html

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://forbritain.org/140518_eu_rebate_blair.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwjph9Wk7OfNAhVkJcAKHaF9Cd8QFggjMAI&usg=AFQjCNFmtmQSYDDg_kKTb48fcQY19PZ5ow&sig2=WGvOnpdL7aT0BjfKUkL4zw

attributes.action: We have no right to light. I think people should be entitled to light
attributes.background: I recently asked the local council to cut some trees that block daylight on my property and disabled neighbours nextdoor. I was advised I have no right to light and the law states this.

attributes.action: Procure the Government to adopt Geraint Davies's private member's Bill.
attributes.background:
Many false and misleading claims were made during the campaign which deceived people who were not able to judge the issues dispassionately. 
These gross misrepresentations at the very least justify a second referendum to determine whether the result is truly the settled will of the people.
attributes.additional_details:
37% of the eligible electorate voted to leave, which means that 63% did not.
Many quite simply were duped into believing extravagant promises which were unachievable, and on which the polititians concerned backtracked afterwards.
Referenda are not binding. 
The sheer magnitude of the consequences already being felt is too great to allow the fundamentally flawed result to be implemented without at the very least clarification of the settled will of the people, or a free vote in both Houses.

attributes.action: Change the way political parties are funded.
attributes.background: Political Parties should be funded from tax revenues only. There should be heavy financial penalties for Parties which renege on manifesto commitments; “fail to mention” major policies in their manifesto which they then implement.
attributes.additional_details: Such funding would help achieve a 'level playing field' for all parties and the removal of rich backers with vested interests and agendas. Financial penalties would help clean up campaigning prior to elections and restore a degree of trust in politicians and the system.

attributes.action: Giving food brought to concerts to homeless so that none goes to waste.
attributes.background: Having recently changed my eating habits and diet that I was going to take some oats and dried fruit at a concert to enjoy as I hoped to sneak them through, in retrospect this was silly but I was still appalled that they simply threw it away despite everything I had being perfectly edible!
